# Draft:Rajiv Gandhi Manav Seva Award

----
The Rajiv Gandhi Manav Seva Award is an Indian civilian honour instituted by the Government of India. It is conferred upon individuals for their outstanding contributions in the fields of child development, child protection, and child welfare. The award recognizes exceptional voluntary service that has significantly impacted the well-being of children.
presenting the awards on Children's Day at Rashtrapati Bhavan, 2017.]]
History
India has a long tradition of voluntary action for the welfare of children. In 1979, the Government of India established a national award to recognize outstanding work in the field of child welfare. Building on this initiative, the Ministry of Women and Child Development later instituted the Rajiv Gandhi Manav Seva Award to specifically honour individuals for their exceptional service.
The award is named after former Prime Minister of India, Rajiv Gandhi. The list of awardees is typically announced on his birth anniversary, 20 August, each year.
Selection process
Eligibility
Up to three individuals are selected for the award each year. The eligibility criteria are:
*The individual must have served the cause of children for a minimum of ten years.
*The work must be voluntary, and individuals who are paid employees of an institution are not eligible for their work at that institution.
*The primary basis for selection is the quality and impact of the individual's work.
National Selection Committee
Awardees are chosen by a National Selection Committee appointed by the government. The committee comprises:
*Minister of State (Independent Charge) for Women & Child Development – Chairperson
*Secretary, Ministry of Women and Child Development
*A representative of the Department of Education
*A representative of the Department of Health
*A representative of the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment
*President, Indian Council for Child Welfare
*Dean, Department of Social Work, University of Delhi
*Joint Secretary, Ministry of Women & Child Development – Member Secretary
Nominations are invited from State Governments and Union Territory Administrations, typically by 20 July each year. The committee may also consider individuals who have not been formally nominated.
Award
Each recipient of the award receives:
*A cash prize of ₹1 lakh.
*A silver plaque and a citation.
The awards are presented at a special ceremony held in New Delhi. In some years, the ceremony has coincided with Children's Day celebrations at Rashtrapati Bhavan. The Ministry of Women and Child Development covers the travel and accommodation expenses for the awardees.
